[UL Only] TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Topology

TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Topology Diagram
[UL Only] TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB 3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane).
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
[UL Only] (Internal RVP) TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB 3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane).
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

[UL Only] (Internal RVP) TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Redriver with M.2 Modular Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link with M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
[UL Only] (Internal RVP) TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Redriver with M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
Supported interfacesUSB 3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane).
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
M.2 ConnectorEquivalent performance with M.2 Gen5 spec connector or better.

[TO BE DELETED] TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Internal Cable Topology

Type-C USB+DP Main Link Internal Cable Topology Diagram
[TO BE DELETED] TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed4 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length250 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V(Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5%, 25 V (Extended Power Range not implemented)/ 50 V (Extended Power Range implemented).
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
203 mm cable assembly76-94 Ω including tolerance. Insertion loss ≥ -2.5 dB @ 2.5 GHz, ≥ -3.3 dB @ 5.0 GHz. Crosstalk ≤ -33 dB @ 5-10 GHz.
Supported interfacesUSB 3.2 Gen 2x2 (10 Gbps per lane) and DP v1.4a (up to 8.1 Gbps per lane)
Length trade-off for mainstream stackupIf 60 mm < BO+M[1:6] ≤ 85 mm then Mcable ≤ 127 mm.
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

Mainstream, Rx,Tx

Category: Mainstream

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: None

[TO BE DELETED] TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x2 + DP Type-C Internal Cable Topology Mainstream, Rx,Tx Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS8
M1+M2MS47
M3+M4+M5+M6MS25
CableCable203

Max Length Total (mm): 47

Max Length Total Note: For DSL max Length is 53mm . ( max Length is excluding Cable length )

TCP USB 3.2 Type-A

TCP USB 3.2 Type-A General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackup0402, if routing near maximum length it is recommended to use 0201 component size.
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for CMCs, ESDs, AC cap and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left no connected at the BGA ball.
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
TCP USB 3.2 Type-A Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.25
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

TCP USB 3.2 Gen 1x1 Type-A Topology

TCP USB 3.2 Gen 1x1 Type-A Topology Diagram
TCP USB 3.2 Gen 1x1 Type-A Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Number of vias allowed3 (route within 2 layers).
Maximum via stub length375 um per via.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground. Prefer ground on both sides.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeOne side can be power plane that has low frequency peak-to-peak noise, the other side must be continuous ground and it is the layer that is closer to the signal route. Prefer ground on both sides.
CMCRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for CMC recommendation(s).
ESDRefer to the EMC Component Selection section of the PDG for ESD recommendation(s).
AC cap value75 nF to 265 nF including tolerance, 25 V.
Supported interfacesUSB3.2 Gen1 (5 Gbps)
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.

TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology

Requirement for Third Party Active Component
TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology Diagram
TCP USB 3.2 Gen 2x1 Type-A Redriver Topology Notes
Note
Note1*: Max/ min routing length for USB3.2 Gen1 & 2 speeds (5/ 10 Gbps) depends on redriver performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel processor. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the processor.

TCP TBT4

TCP TBT4 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Optimal routingFor optimal performance it is recommended to begin layout with TBT routing, use arc routing and maintain 3H spacing to vias/ void/ splits. It's also recommended that return loss specification of routing from retimer to Type-C connector is met. It is listed in section 5.5.1.1 of USB Type-C TBT Specification (Document #557111).
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupRecommend 0201 components. It is OK to use 0402 component between processor and retimer when NOT routing near maximum length. Strongly recommend 0201 components between retimer and Type-C connector, 0402 components may result in return loss spec violation.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. See notes on each topology for Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 25 V.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left unconnected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to "Switching VR Circuit Guidelines" in the "General Design Considerations" section as well as Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Dual-stripline routing recommendationDual-stripline routings refer to "General Dual-Stripline Support" section. When routing orthogonal or with angle on top of TBT5 DSL tlines, allow maximum of 3 aggressor pairs to route over 1 DSL routing victim pair.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
TCP0_dfx_dmonobs_n/p_lv[1:0]Do not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP0_dfx_amon_obs_lvDo not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP TBT4 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer Topology

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer Topology Diagram
TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 forJune Bridge 40 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 40
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum Via Stub Length is 250um
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo Via Stub Allowed

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameInstanceCategoryStartEnd
TXDevice01

M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC Cap1Capacitor45
RetimerDevice56
M3Trace611
RcResistor1112
ESDDevice1213
M4Trace1314
AC Cap2Capacitor1415
AC Cap2Capacitor1416
RbResistor1617
GNDGround17-1
M5Trace1518
Type-C ConnectorDevice18-1

TX_RXDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
M2Trace34
AC Cap1Capacitor45
Retimer1Device56
M3Trace67
M4Trace78
AC Cap2Capacitor89
Retimer2Device910
M5Trace1011

M6Trace1314

M7Trace1518

Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Mid Loss (ML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer Topology Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2 = 205mm. If more than 90% of the routing is Stripline or Dual-stripline, the maximum total length can be extended to 225 mm (M1 + M2 = 217 mm).

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2=205mm. T4 10L Premium Mid Loss (PML): If more than 90% routing is Stripline the maximum length can be extended to 225 mm (M1+M2 = 217 mm). T3 10L Premium Mid Loss (PML): If more than 90% is routing is Stripline or Dual stripline, the maximum total length can be extended up to 240 mm (M1+M2 = 232 mm).

BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2=205mm. If more than 90% of the routing is Stripline or Dual-stripline, the maximum total length can be extended to 225 mm (M1 + M2 = 217 mm).

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology

TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Diagram
TCP TBT4 June Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 forJune Bridge 40 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 40
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

CableCable255This cable length assumes a micro-coax cable assembly that is electrically compliant with the specification given in document #575032.

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology

TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology Diagram
(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 forJune Bridge 40 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge 40
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum Via Stub Length is 250um
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo Via Stub Allowed

Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Mid Loss (ML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2=205mm. If more than 90% of the routing is Stripline or Dual-stripline, the maximum total length can be extended to 225 mm (M1 + M2 = 217 mm).

Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: Mainstream

Material: Premium Mid Loss (PML)

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology Mainstream, Premium Mid Loss (PML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL205Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 205

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2=205mm. T4 10L Premium Mid Loss (PML): If more than 90% routing is Stripline the maximum length can be extended to 225 mm (M1+M2 = 217 mm). T3 10L Premium Mid Loss (PML): If more than 90% is routing is Stripline or Dual stripline, the maximum total length can be extended up to 240 mm (M1+M2 = 232 mm).

Rx,Tx, Post-Channel

Category: None

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Post-Channel

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer Topology Rx,Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
M3+M4+M5MS30

Max Length Total (mm): 30

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology

TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Diagram
(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 forJune Bridge 40 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 recommended. - Rated voltage: 25 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerHayden Bridge 40
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads4.5 dB @ 10 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 4.0, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

(Internal Only) TCP TBT4 Hayden Bridge Retimer with Internal Cable Topology Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL8
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL110DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.
M3MS, DSL, SL20DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.
CableCable255This cable length assumes a micro-coax cable assembly that is electrically compliant with the specification given in document #575032.

Max Length Total (mm): 110

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2+M3=110mm. Max length not including cable.

TCP TBT5

Void Above and Below Buried Vias PTH Pads in Type-4 Stackup
Voids Under SOC Ball Pads
TCP TBT5 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Voiding recommendation for mainstream stackupIt is recommended to void unused (non-functional) pads for differential vias and pin pads for ESDs, AC caps and connectors to optimize the impedance matching in the channel.
Optimal routingFor optimal performance it is recommended to begin layout with TBT routing, use arc routing and maintain 3H spacing to vias/ void/ splits. It's also recommended that return loss specification of routing from retimer to Type-C connector is met. It is listed in section 5.5.1.1 of USB Type-C TBT Specification (Document #557111).
Discrete component part size for mainstream stackupRecommend 0201 components. It is OK to use 0402 component between processor and retimer when NOT routing near maximum length. Strongly recommend 0201 components between retimer and Type-C connector, 0402 components may result in return loss spec violation.
Recommended short protection circuitIt is recommended to include this circuit to comply with USB ECN \"RX AC Coupling Capacitor Option\" to provide ESD/ EOS protection and set RX bias at the Type-C connector. See notes on each topology for Intel's recommendation on DC rating of the Crx. The customer should consider short event to VBUS that can be up to 25 V.
Unused signalsUnused data and AUX signals should be left unconnected at the BGA ball.
Routing and return via requirement near vertical transitionFor all vertical transitions, the differential transmission lines should be connected to the two vias symmetrically. Moreover, Vss return vias should be placed near the signal vias in an equidistant symmetrical manner and all signal vias should have identical Vss return vias around each of them.
Recommendations and considerations for routing near switch mode power supply, routing under inductor, routing under phase node, and routing under DrMOSRefer to "Switching VR Circuit Guidelines" in the "General Design Considerations" section as well as Technical White Paper Doc#:  726825
Dual-stripline routing recommendationDual-stripline routings refer to "General Dual-Stripline Support" section. When routing orthogonal or with angle on top of TBT5 DSL tlines, allow maximum of 3 aggressor pairs to route over 1 DSL routing victim pair.
General Guidelines
NoteDetail
TCP0_dfx_dmonobs_n/p_lv[1:0]Do not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP0_dfx_amon_obs_lvDo not include in external PDG. Route as 50 Ω single ended impedance traces. Provide good noise isolation (12 mil minimum). Connect to SMA/ SMP.
TCP TBT5 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.125
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.125
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes25
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Diagram
TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Component PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads5.8 dB @ 13 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4 V2 Gen4, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes

Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo Via Stub Allowed

TCP TBT5 Retimer Topology Mainstream, Mid Loss (ML), Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL2Minimize BO length to less than 2 mm in the escape area near ball for Microstrip lines on Top or Bottom layer. Don't need to consider BO in the inner layer.
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL190Refer to Max length Total Note for details. DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 190

Max Length Total Note: BO+M1+M2 = 190mm. If more than 90% of the routing is Stripline or Dual-stripline, the maximum total length can be extended to 225 mm (M1 + M2 = 223 mm).

GNDGround17-1
M7Trace1518
Type-C ConnectorDevice18-1

Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: None

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

TCP TBT5 Cascaded Retimer Topology Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL2
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL190DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.
M3+M4MS, DSL, SL190DSL may cause via stub to be longer than the maximum required 250um. Via stub mitigation routing technique may be employed.

Max Length Total (mm): 380

Max Length Total Note: For Premium Mid Loss (PML) T3 stack up able to extend the length to 390mm. Premium Mid Loss T4 and Thin PCB need to meet the length in table above.

Rx,Tx, Post-Channel

Category: None

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Post-Channel

TCP TBT5 Cascaded Retimer Topology Rx,Tx, Post-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
M5+M6+M7MS, SL30

Max Length Total (mm): 30

(Internal Validation) TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology

TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology Diagram
(Internal Validation) TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Routing styleMicrostrip main route routing must be interleaved. To reduce system RFI/ EMI, it is recommended to use SL instead of MS. If MS routing is needed, refer to EMC PDG for RFI/ EMI mitigation.
Reference plane for microstrip routeMust be continuous ground.
Reference plane for stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
Reference plane for dual stripline routeFull ground reference is required. Dual reference/ Power reference not allowed.
ESDPlease refer to Thunderbolt Retimer documentation for more details. Refer to RDC #843990 for June Bridge 80 Retimer guidelines.
AC Cap positionNA
AC cap value135 nF to 265 nF including tolerance. For the post-channel cap - Form factor 0201 required - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported For the pre-channel cap - Form factor 0201 recommended - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Component PlacementESD Diode, AC cap, Rb Resistor and Rc Resistor should be placed as close as possible to USBC connector up to 8mm radius
Crx cap value297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance. - Form factor: 0201 required. - Rated voltage: 6.3 V. - Rated voltage 25V if 60W supported When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: - Form factor: 0402 recommended. - Rated voltage: 63 V.
Rb resistor value220 kΩ ± 5% Form factor: 0201 recommended.
Rc resistor value2.2 Ω ± 10% - Form factor: 0201 recommended. When the Extended Power Range Power Delivery (EPR) is implemented: i. If EPR is @ 28 V, then Rc should be 2.7 Ω ± 5%. ii. If EPR is @ 36 V, then Rc should be 3.24 Ω ± 5%. iii. If EPR is @ 48 V, then Rc should be 4.02 Ω ± 5%.
TX bleed resistor placeholderRecommend having a placeholder for an 0201 Rb resistor between the AC cap and Type-C connector on the SSTX pairs.
RetimerJune Bridge 80
Total insertion loss budget from retimer pins to Type-C connector pads5.8 dB @ 13 GHz on PCB. Inclusive of HVM variation. Not inclusive of connector.
Supported interfacesThunderbolt 5.0, Thunderbolt 4.0, USB4 V2 Gen4, USB4.0 Gen3, USB3.2 Gen2x2 and DP2.1 (UHBR20).
FiberweaveMust adhere to fiberweave related best routing practices (#406926).
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia PlacementNotes
Rx, Tx2Pre-ChannelMaximum Via Stub Length is 250um
Rx, Tx2Post-ChannelNo Via Stub Allowed

Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel

Category: None

Material: None

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Redriver/Retimer: Pre-Channel

(Internal Validation) TCP TBT5 Retimer M.2 Modular Topology Rx,Tx, Pre-Channel Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, SL2
M1+M2MS, DSL, SL165Length with HVM variation
M3MS, DSL, SL20

Max Length Total (mm): 187

Max Length Total Note: Please provide RVP stackup for RVP max total length calculation

UFS 4.0

Description: UFS in NVL support Gear5 data rate.

UFS 4.0 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 254 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Component size requirement ( CMC)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
UFS 4.0 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.127
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)Yes12.7
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

Reference planeContinuous ground recommended.

Breakout length and spacingAn initial breakout segment of 4 mm in length with a tighter pair-to-pair spacing of 0.11 mm - 0.16 mm is allowed.

USB 3.2 Gen 1

Description: This PHY only supports configuration with standard Type-A connector.

USB 3.2 Stub Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB 3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB 3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
USB 3.2 Gen 1 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch < 0.254 mm. Total length mismatch < 0.127 mm.
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB 3.2 Gen 1 & Gen 2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.
USB 3.2 Gen 1 Length Matching
Matching Group IdMatching GroupsTotal/Within LayerLength/DelayRequiredMaximum Mismatch
1Pair (P-N)TotalLength (mm)Yes0.127
2Pair (P-N)WithinLength (mm)Yes0.254
3TX-TXTotalLength (mm)No0
4RX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
5TX-RXTotalLength (mm)No0
6DATA-CLKTotalLength (mm)No0

USB 3.2 Gen 2

Description: This PHY only supports configuration with standard Type-A connector.

USB 3.2 Stub Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Routing Requirement
USB 3.2 Component Pad Voiding Requirement
USB 3.2 Receptacle Ground Void Dimension Recommendations
USB 3.2 Signals to PTH Transition Requirement
USB 3.2 Gen 2 General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Length matching between P and N within a diff. pairWithin same layer mismatch < 0.254 mm. Total length mismatch < 0.127 mm.
Stub requirementChannel and via stub requirement must meet < 381 um for both Tx and Rx signal pairs.
Tx AC cap value for USB 3.2 Gen 1 & Gen 2AC capacitor value: 100 nF nominal (75 nF - 265 nF range).
Short circuit protection for Type-C topology (if applicable)Crx cap value: 297 nF to 363 nF including tolerance, 25 V. Rb resistor value: 220 kΩ ± 5%.
Component size requirement ( CMC, ESD, AC cap, Resistor)Strongly recommended to use 0201 components for better impedance control.
Component voidingAll component pads must be voided on L2 and with GND reference on L3. Suggest having pad voiding size of 50.8 um overcut. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Component routingSignal pair to entry/ exist from components pad symmetrically. Maintain differential routing to meet trace target impedance whenever possible.
Signal PTH/ via transitionDifferential pair voiding needed for each signal pair transition with recommended antipad size of 0.75 mm. Suggest having two symmetrical GND stitching vias for each signal pair transition.
Cable and connector recommendationStrongly recommended to use SMT connectors. For PTH connectors (assuming connector is on the top), USB3.2 signals need to be routed from the bottom of the board such that there is no stub on for connector entry. Intel strongly recommends selecting cables and connectors which meet electrical requirements specified in both USB-IF Cable and Connector Specification dated June 2017 and Universal Serial Bus 3.1 Legacy Connectors and Cable Assemblies Compliance dated April 2018. The USB-IF does not certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen2 stacked connectors. The USB-IF does certify legacy or USB Type-C(tm) Gen1 stacked connectors. Refer USB-IF for more details.
PTH connector voiding requirementDifferential oval antipad required for all layers. Suggest using differential signal antipad with 2 mm size.
Repeater pad voidingA differential void on L2 that is larger than the repeater with 50.8 um overcut is recommended. GND referencing is needed on L3. Refer to Component Pad Voiding diagram.
Routing schemeNon-interleaved breakout (B0) is required to mitigate near-end crosstalk. The main route (MR) supports both interleaved routing and non-interleaved routing for maximum flexibility on stripline (SL). For microstrip (MS), interleaved routing scheme is recommended.
Reference planeContinuous GND is recommended. If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). If non-continuous power referencing is unavoidable on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt), but stitching caps are required over each plane split and need to be placed within 6 mm of a signal running across the plane split.

Note
This assumes internal cable insertion loss of ~3 dB @ 5 GHz. Refer to USB3.2 "Front-Panel Internal Cable And Connector White Paper" for more details.
Note1*: Max/ min routing length for USB 3.2 Gen 1 & 2 speeds (5/ 10 Gbps) depends on redriver performance and its loss compensation capability when used in conjunction with Intel processor. Work with repeater vendor to ensure the selected part can provide adequate signal integrity at the processor.

CLINK

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
CLINK 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Maximum trace DC resistance 14 Ω
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Signal name/ listCL_CLK, CL_DATA, CL_RST#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx5Total Channel
Tx5Total Channel

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
CONNECTORDevice3-1

CNVi BRI and RGI

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology

CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load M.2 Connector Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Module Down Topology Diagram
CNVi BRI and RGI 1-Load Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Max frequency40 MHz
M4 (BRI_RSP)For microstrip and stripline routing only on platform, the total main board trace length can be extended up to 253.7 mm. For that, it is recommended to implement M4 < 228.3 mm (max).
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended for microstrip line. [2] Dual continuous GND is recommended for strip line. [3] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [4] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
R110 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. To be placed 12.7 mm (can be extended to 25.4 mm) from the processor for CNV_BRI_DT and CNV_RGI_DT signal.
R2 (RGI)For Wi-Fi 7 BE201, Wi-Fi 7 BE211 and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_RGI_RSP signal.
R2 (BRI)For Wi-Fi 7 BE211 and Wi-Fi 7 BE213; 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 25.4 mm. For Wi-Fi 7 BE201; [1] 10 Ω ± 5% for max total length ≥ 101.6 mm [2] 27 Ω ± 5% for max total length < 101.6 mm To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector for CNV_BRI_RSP signal.
Length restriction for full Dual Stripline routingM1 + M2 = 63.5 mm (max). M3 + M4 = 63.5 mm (max).
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Signal name/ listCNV_BRI_DT, CNV_RGI_DT, CNV_BRI_RSP, CNV_RGI_RSP.

Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx4Total Channel

DMIC

DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology

DMIC 2-Load Branch CLK Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch DATA Topology Diagram
DMIC 2-Load Branch Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the processor, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. [1] R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches. [2] If the branches not immediately split after connector, please follow rule [1].
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between branchBranch 1 and branch 2 need to be length matched within 2.54 mm.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 Ω. [2] GPP_S: 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listDMIC_CLK_A[0:1], DMICA_CLK_A[0:1], DMIC_DATA[0:1], DMICA_DATA[0:1].
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

DMIC 2-Load Daisy Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1 & C1[1] EMI RC filter placeholder: Stuff R1 with 0 Ω and unstuff C1 by default. Refer to EMC section for details. [2] To be placed only for DMIC_CLK. [3] C1 is recommended to be placed close to R1. C1 is recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the processor, but can be extended to 25.4 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum. If M1 is routed on MS, EMI RC filter should be placed at the beginning of the MS routing.
R250 Ω. R2 is recommended to be placed immediate after the branches from connector.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between CLK and DATA signalsN/A
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D: 40 Ω. [2] GPP_S: 50 Ω, slew 11.

eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
eSPI 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency50 MHz
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI base specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).
R130 Ω ± 5% on ESPI_CLK and ESPI_IO[0:3].
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals[1] 0.125 mm for MS and SL Tline Type [2] 0.250 mm for DSL Tline Type
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor Buffer drive strength33 Ω

NoteDetail
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency[1] Device 1: EC at 50 MHz. [2] Device 2: SIO at 33 MHz.
Device assumptionCompliant to Intel ESPI Base Specification 1.0 (66 MHz and above).

GSPI

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In-Card) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency25 MHz
R10 Ω placeholder. To be placed on GSPI[0:2]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]A_CLK, GSPI[0:2]_MOSI and GSPI[0:1]A_MOSI.
R222 Ω ± 5%. To be placed on GSPI[0:2]_MISO and GSPI[0:1]A_MISO.
Device AC electrical and timing characteristics [1] Impedance: 50 Ω to 100 Ω. [2] 0.85 ns < rise/ fall time measured at 20%-80% < 1.9 ns based on 10 pF test load. [3] 1.6 pF ≤ input capacitance, Cin ≤ 1.75 pF. [4] Data input setup time < 9 ns. [5] Data input hold time < 5 ns. [6] 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 14 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength50 Ω.
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:2]_CLK, GSPI[0:2]_MISO, GSPI[0:2]_MOSI, GSPI[0:2]_CS0#, GSPI[0:1]A_CLK, GSPI[0:1]A_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]A_MISO, GSPI[0:1]A_CS0#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
CONNECTORDevice5-1

Signal Group: Rx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M2Trace23
R2Resistor34
M1Trace45
CONNECTORDevice5-1

Segment Lengths

GSPI 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Segment Lengths Routing Guidelines
SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)Max Length Segment Note
BOMS, DSL, SL12.7
M1MS, DSL, SL12.7
M2MS, DSL, SL114.3M2 can support up to 190.5mm but the frequency needs to be reduced to 20MHz only. M2 length should comprise of M2+AIC lengths.

Min Length Total (mm): 50.8

Max Length Total (mm): 139.7

Max Length Total Note: Total length can be further increased to 215.9 mm but the bus frequency needs to reduce to 20 MHz.

GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology

GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Diagram
GSPI 1-Load (for Touch Panel) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Max frequency12 MHz
R118 Ω ± 5%. To be placed 12.7 mm from the connector on GSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, and GSPI0A_MISO.
M_cableRecommended to use shielded cable.
Length matching between CLK and DATA/ CS# signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listGSPI[0:1]_CLK, GSPI[0:1]_MISO, GSPI[0:1]_MOSI, GSPI[0:1]_CS0#, GSPI0A_CLK, GSPI0A_MOSI, GSPI0A_MISO, GSPI0A_CS0#.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Rx, Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
M1Trace23
R1Resistor34
M2Trace45
CONNECTORDevice5-1

M1MS, DSL, SL228.6

Max Length Total (mm): 711.2

HDA

HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
HDA 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R10 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the processor, but can be extended to 76.2 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R233 Ω ± 10%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Reference plane(1) Continuous GND is recommended. (2) If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). (3) If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Dual stripline (DSL)No parallelism between CLK and DATA signals, as well as DATA and DATA signals.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listHDA_SDO, HDA_SDI0, HDA_BCLK, HDA_SYNC, HDA_RST#.

I2C

I2C General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Note 1Multiple options for pull-up/ pull-down and current assist strengths are provided for a particular total bus capacitance. Choose the optimal value for system based on design considerations like power, BOM and cost.
Note 2Trace capacitance per inch is approximately CL = 85√єr / Zo pF, єr - dielectric constant of material, Zo - trace impedance.
Note 3Bus capacitance calculation assumptions: [1] Device capacitance = 5 pF to 10 pF per I2C device. [2] Motherboard board trace capacitance = 2 pF to 5 pF per inch of trace length. [3] Processor pin capacitance = 8 pF to 10 pF.

I2C Topology

I2C Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "xxxxxx_NVL-H_I2C_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[3A:5A]_SDA, I2C[3A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA.

Frequency: 100 kHz

Up to 50 pF8.2 kΩ100 Ω

Up to 200 pF2.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 300 pF1.5 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 400 pF1.2 kΩ100 Ω

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology

I2C for DDR5 SPD Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Stackup layer (microstrip/ stripline/ dual stripline)MS/ SL/ DSL.
Characteristic impedance30 Ω to 70 Ω.
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Trace spacing between SCL and other signals [1] 0.375 mm: Frequency of other signals > 1 GHz. [2] 0.250 mm: Frequency of other signals > 100 MHz. [3] 0.125 mm: Frequency of other signals ≤ 100 MHz.
Trace spacing between SDA and other signals0.125 mm
Trace segment lengthRefer to bus capacitance table.
Total trace length (SDA, SCL)Individual trace lengths should meet total bus capacitance (Cb) requirements for the mode of operation. Refer to the pull-up/ pull-down tables for the supported bus capacitance.
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Pull-up resistor placementNo restriction.
Pull-up resistor value tolerance± 5%
Max stub length to pull-up resistor25.4 mm
Max stub length to device127 mm
Board trace characteristic assumptions for default pull-up recommendationBoard trace resistance per length = 20 Ω per meter. Board trace capacitance per length = 208 pF per meter.
Extended length supportFor extended length support, refer to "xxxxxx_NVL-H_I2C_SMLINK_LSIO_Flexi_PDG". Potential enablers: [1] Reduced trace resistance. [2] Reduced trace capacitance. [3] Optimized pull-up resistor placement.
Max SPD device input capacitance5 pF
General recommendations for DDR5 SPD[1] It is recommended to have a dedicated bus for DDR5 SPD usage. [2] If dedicated bus is not possible, it is recommended to use a voltage translator to shift the signal down to 1V to match the SPD device.
Signal name/ listI2C[0:5]_SDA, I2C[0:5]_SCL, I2C[3A:5A]_SDA, I2C[3A:5A]_SCL, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SDA, ISH_I2C[0:2]_SCL, ISH_I2C2A_SDA, ISH_I2C2A_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SCL, THC_I2C[0:1]_SDA.

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz)

Frequency: 100 kHz

I2C Standard Mode (100 kHz) Settings
Total Bus Capacitance (Cb)External Pull-up StrengthIntel Silicon Pull-down Strength
Up to 50 pF8.2 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 100 pF4.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 200 pF2.7 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 300 pF1.8 kΩ100 Ω
Up to 400 pF1.5 kΩ50 Ω

I2S

I2S General Guidelines
NoteDetail
Host/ device mode terminologyHost Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by Intel processor. Device Mode refers to the mode where the clock is driven by external device.

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R115 Ω ± 5% Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from processor, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R227 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement

Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Segment NameCategoryStartEnd

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Signal Ganging with CNVi GPIO Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 1-Load (Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R115 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from processor, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R227 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from connector/ header.
R3 (applicable to I2S to discrete CNV module topology only)1k Ω. Used for ganging I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals. Required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point.
Additional guidelines for I2S to discrete CNV module topology[1] For I2S topology connecting to discrete connectivity module, there is a requirement to share/ gang I2S signals with CNVi GPIO signals (RF_RESET_B and CLKREQ) onto the same physical line: - I2S_SFRM with RF_RESET_B - I2S_TXD with CLKREQ [2] A 1k Ω resistor (R3) is required on the CNVi GPIO signals, to be placed <2" from the ganging point. [3] Location of the ganging is not restricted and can be implemented anywhere along the bus. [4] Refer to "I2S signal ganging with CNVi GPIO" diagram for guidance on the implementation. Note that the I2S series resistors (R1 and R2) are still needed and considered in a separate topology diagram.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.
Max Number of vias
Signal GroupMax Number of Vias AllowedVia Placement
Rx, Tx7Total Channel
Tx7Total Channel
Rx7Total Channel

Signal Group: Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
M1Trace34
ConnectorDevice4-1

The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). NoteDetail
R1[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 47 Ω ± 10%. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 0 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from processor, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R222 Ω ± 5%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from device.
Max frequency12.288 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.

I2S Host Mode: 4-Load Daisy Chain (Cable and Add-In Card) Topology

I2S Host Mode: 4-load Daisy Chain (Cable and Add-In Card) Topology Diagram
I2S Host Mode: 4-Load Daisy Chain (Cable and Add-In Card) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
R1[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 56 Ω ± 10%. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 0 Ω placeholder. Recommended to be placed 25.4 mm from processor, but can be extended to 50.8 mm maximum if required. The length of breakout section (BO) is still 12.7 mm maximum.
R227 Ω ± 10%. Recommended to be placed 12.7 mm from the device.
Max frequency6.144 MHz
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Device AC timing characteristics Data input setup time < 10 ns. Data input hold time < 10 ns. 0 ns < CLK to DATA output valid time < 30 ns.
Length matching between CLK and DATA signals12.7 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.125 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Trace spacing between port to port0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength[1] GPP_D (I2S0): 50 Ω. [2] GPP_S (I2S1/ I2S2): 50 Ω, slew 11.
Signal name/ listI2S[0:2]_SCLK, I2S[0:2]_SFRM, I2S[0:2]_TXD, I2S[0:2]_RXD.

I3C

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology

I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 1-Island (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, routing should follow I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 1016 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology'Island’ refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from processor.
CPU TX timing register configurationSDA_TX_HOLD = 0x2
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Processor buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω
Signal name/ listI3C[0:3]_SDA, I3C[0:3]_SCL, I3C[0:1]A_SDA, I3C[0:1]A_SCL, I3C3A_SDA, I3C3A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL, I3C1B_SDA, I3C1B_SCL.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
RpuResistor45
1p8VRail5-1
M1Trace36
IslandDevice6-1

Segment Lengths For Mixed I3C/I2C Bus, Up To I2C Fast Mode

SegmentTline TypeMax Length Segment (mm)
BOMS, DSL, SL25.4
M1MS, DSL, SL990.6

Max Length Total (mm): 1016

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology

I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Diagram
I3C 2-Island Daisy Chain (Device Down) Topology Notes
NoteDetail
Mixed bus topologyThis topology supports usages with a mix of I2C and I3C devices. For mixed I2C and I3C bus, the routing needs to follow the I3C PDG.
Reduced max lengthActual max length for I3C can go up to 762 mm. Reduced max length is due to legacy I2C Fast Mode Plus (FM+) requirement.
Island terminology‘Island’ refers to 1 to 3 devices connected and placed near to each other, where the max capacitance per island is 20 pF. For multiple devices within an island, the max stub length to each device is 25.4 mm.
Max frequency2 MHz
Rpu1 kΩ.
R120 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance from processor.
R220 Ω. Placed within 25.4 mm distance to device.
CPU TX timing register configurationSDA_TX_HOLD = 0x2
Reference plane[1] Continuous GND is recommended. [2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).
Length matching between SDA and SCL signals25.4 mm
Trace spacing between DATA and DATA signals0.250 mm
Trace spacing between CLK and DATA/ other signals0.375 mm
Max device buffer driver strength90 Ω
Processor buffer driver strength40 Ω.
Signal name/ listI3C[0:3]_SDA, I3C[0:3]_SCL, I3C[0:1]A_SDA, I3C[0:1]A_SCL, I3C3A_SDA, I3C3A_SCL, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SDA, ISH_I3C[0:1]_SCL, I3C1B_SDA, I3C1B_SCL.

Signal Group: Rx-Tx

Signal MRTS
Segment NameInstanceCategoryStartEnd
CPUDevice01
BOTrace12
R1Resistor23
R1Resistor24
RpuResistor45
1p8VRail5-1
M1Trace36
M1Trace37
R21Resistor68
BI1Trace89
Island1Device9-1
M2Trace710
R22Resistor1011
BI2Trace1112
Island2Device12-1

[2] If continuous GND cannot be implemented, a combination of GND on one side and continuous power plane on the other side with the condition that the GND plane be the closer reference (dual-reference) can be implemented. The continuous power plane requires low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt). [3] If non-continuous power referencing is required on microstrip/ surface layer, signal can reference over power planes with a low peak-to-peak noise and low current switching speed (di/dt).

M_Cable electrical characteristic target[1] 50 Ω ± 5 Ω. (including cable manufacturing tolerance). [2] Max insertion loss: > -0.7 5dB @ 200 MHz. [3] Max return loss: < -13 dB @ 200 MHz.
